message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.NE, cs.SY, cs.IT

This paper discusses the training of Restricted Boltzmann Machines (RBMs) using the Minimum Probability Flow (MPF) learning algorithm. RBMs are commonly used in machine learning, particularly in deep neural networks, which suggests that the paper could belong to the cs.LG (Machine Learning) sub-category. The paper also discusses the theoretical motivation behind MPF and its comparison to the contrastive divergence (CD) algorithm, which suggests that it could belong to the cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) sub-category. Additionally, the paper explores the consequences of different choices for the sampling dynamics in MPF, which suggests that it could belong to the cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) sub-category. The paper also discusses the relationship between MPF and statistical physics, which suggests that it could belong to the cs.SY (Systems and Control) sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a more general form for the sampling dynamics in MPF, which suggests that it could belong to the cs.IT (Information Theory) sub-category.
